subject: Implement ResetConfig and ClearForeignConfig functionality
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-10 16:21:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Implemented ResetConfig and ClearForeignConfig functionality for raid deletion

Change-Id: I76390dc4fcf8de2fe5aa3d660f77edcef4a4dec1
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2019-04-15 09:37:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Implemented ResetConfig and ClearForeignConfig functionality for raid deletion.
As existing delete_virtual_disk functinality is not freeing up foreign drives
and spares, so we have added ResetConfig and ClearForeignConfig functionality
for freeing up foreign drives and spares.

commit_message:
Implement ResetConfig and ClearForeignConfig functionality

For raid deletion, existing delete_virtual_disk functionality is not
freeing up foreign drives and spares, so have added ResetConfig and
ClearForeignConfig functionality for freeing up foreign drives and
spares.

Change-Id: I76390dc4fcf8de2fe5aa3d660f77edcef4a4dec1

commit_message:
Don't warn on network-vif-unplugged event during live migration

The "network-vif-unplugged" event is expected during live migration
and nothing listens for it so we should not log a warning in that case.

Change-Id: I8fd8df211670f1abbcb7b496e62589295922bdc1
Closes-Bug: #1819764
(cherry picked from commit 521e59224e8a595af66ec898f1bb739a9dbe7d97)
(cherry picked from commit 17e6ca727207a21028f2878a1e01047c1be2ad36)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10135, 'name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'display_name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'email': 'lyarwood@redhat.com', 'username': 'lyarwood'}, {'_account_id': 14595, 'name': 'z Systems KVM', 'email': 'zkvm-ci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibm-zkvm-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22623, 'name': 'Erik Olof Gunnar Andersson', 'email': 'eandersson@blizzard.com', 'username': 'eoandersson'}, {'_account_id': 26515, 'name': 'Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'nova_hyperv_ci@cloudbasesolutions.com', 'username': 'nova_hyperv_ci'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-12 18:58:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Error out migration when confirm_resize fails

If anything fails and raises an exception during
confirm_resize, the migration status is stuck in
"confirming" status even though the instance status
may be "ERROR".

This change adds the errors_out_migration decorator
to the confirm_resize method to make sure the migration
status is "error" if an error is raised.

In bug 1821594 it was the driver.confirm_migration
method that raised some exception, so a unit test is
added here which simulates a similar scenario.

This only partially closes the bug because we are still
leaking allocations on the source node resource provider
since _delete_allocation_after_move is not called. That
will be dealt with in a separate patch.

Conflicts:
      nova/tests/functional/test_servers.py
      nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py

NOTE(mriedem): The functional test conflict is due to not
having change I99427a52676826990d2a2ffc82cf30ad945b939c
in Rocky. The unit test conflict is due to not having
change I0851e2d54a1fdc82fe3291fb7e286e790f121e92 in Rocky.
The source_node attribute on the fake Migration object in
the unit test is added here because change
I312d61383345ea0ac1ab0c277b4c468e6aa94656 is not in Rocky.

commit_message:
Error out migration when confirm_resize fails

If anything fails and raises an exception during
confirm_resize, the migration status is stuck in
"confirming" status even though the instance status
may be "ERROR".

This change adds the errors_out_migration decorator
to the confirm_resize method to make sure the migration
status is "error" if an error is raised.

In bug 1821594 it was the driver.confirm_migration
method that raised some exception, so a unit test is
added here which simulates a similar scenario.

This only partially closes the bug because we are still
leaking allocations on the source node resource provider
since _delete_allocation_after_move is not called. That
will be dealt with in a separate patch.

Conflicts:
      nova/tests/functional/test_servers.py
      nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py

NOTE(mriedem): The functional test conflict is due to not
having change I99427a52676826990d2a2ffc82cf30ad945b939c
in Rocky. The unit test conflict is due to not having
change I0851e2d54a1fdc82fe3291fb7e286e790f121e92 in Rocky.
The source_node attribute on the fake Migration object in
the unit test is added here because change
I312d61383345ea0ac1ab0c277b4c468e6aa94656 is not in Rocky.

Change-Id: Ic7d78ad43a2bad7f932c22c98944accbbed9e9e2
Partial-Bug: #1821594
(cherry picked from commit 408ef8f84a698f764aa5d769d6d01fd9340de2e5)
(cherry picked from commit 972d4e0eb391e83fe8d3020ff95db0e6a840a224)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10135, 'name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'display_name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'email': 'lyarwood@redhat.com', 'username': 'lyarwood'}, {'_account_id': 14595, 'name': 'z Systems KVM', 'email': 'zkvm-ci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibm-zkvm-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16128, 'name': 'IBM PowerVM CI', 'email': 'powervmci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powervmci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 26515, 'name': 'Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'nova_hyperv_ci@cloudbasesolutions.com', 'username': 'nova_hyperv_ci'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-29 13:48:25.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': 'Temporarily mutate migration object in finish_revert_resize

As the comment in the code suggests, when calling migrate_instance_finish
in finish_revert_resize we need to temporarily set the migration
object dest_compute to the source_compute since we are moving port
bindings from the dest back to the source. However, this is not
really a temporary change to the object if something fails after
this because the @errors_out_migration decorator will persist the
change which could be confusing later if trying to debug this migration
from the API and the dest_compute and source_compute have the same value.

This fixes the issue by using the temporary_mutation utility.

Also, the obj_to_primitive dance in here is removed since it is not
necessary as migrate_instance_finish handles a Migration object.

Conflicts:
      nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to not having change
I0851e2d54a1fdc82fe3291fb7e286e790f121e92 in Rocky.

Change-Id: I312d61383345ea0ac1ab0c277b4c468e6aa94656
Closes-Bug: #1818730
(cherry picked from commit 855b5546564f0ed96243623b67b1322e9b891c8b)
(cherry picked from commit bcb42a43a9f12d929ec7025f29bd2e3d482cd406)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Temporarily mutate migration object in finish_revert_resize

As the comment in the code suggests, when calling migrate_instance_finish
in finish_revert_resize we need to temporarily set the migration
object dest_compute to the source_compute since we are moving port
bindings from the dest back to the source. However, this is not
really a temporary change to the object if something fails after
this because the @errors_out_migration decorator will persist the
change which could be confusing later if trying to debug this migration
from the API and the dest_compute and source_compute have the same value.

This fixes the issue by using the temporary_mutation utility.

Also, the obj_to_primitive dance in here is removed since it is not
necessary as migrate_instance_finish handles a Migration object.

Conflicts:
      nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to not having change
I0851e2d54a1fdc82fe3291fb7e286e790f121e92 in Rocky.

Change-Id: I312d61383345ea0ac1ab0c277b4c468e6aa94656
Closes-Bug: #1818730
(cherry picked from commit 855b5546564f0ed96243623b67b1322e9b891c8b)
(cherry picked from commit bcb42a43a9f12d929ec7025f29bd2e3d482cd406)

commit_message:
Capture OpenStack services inspection data

Oslo.service eventlet_backdoor allows to inspect Openstack services and
capture processes greenthreads, nativethreads, python memory objects and
python function calltrace. We enable rally to capture this data during
rally scenario runs which helps developers to debug performance issues.
In this change, we add support for profiling function calltrace.

https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.service/latest/user/usage.html#profiling
https://github.com/openstack/oslo.service/blob/master/oslo_service/eventlet_backdoor.py#L198
http://eventlet.net/doc/modules/backdoor.html

Change-Id: Iaa508f47579f8fea470b1d2bed73584027138eeb

commit_message:
Revert "Increase tag-releases job timeout"

Parent job is currently marked final, so attempting to override setting
here causes an error when zuul tries to load the job graph.

This reverts commit cd3ac58467ac73eba4348ea6ecf4142bf019527e.

Change-Id: Idcb8f5ceadcc36af1cceace84691e505409c6ebd

commit_message:
neutron.conf needs lock_path set for router to operate
This change is adding required configuration in neutron.conf
to set the lock_path parameter, which was missing in
compute-install-ubuntu.rst

Change-Id: If090bdf060dfe21d11b1a5dfd010dc8167d9e45e
Closes-Bug: #1796976

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: I0d658b3d18686845dc4d388ebbba32a0fc41529c

commit_message:
Add list-manageable for rbd

Right now, the rbd backend does not support to list manageable
volume and snapshot. So add it.

Change-Id: I2a8c007c445992c5d95481baf22535019348e256

commit_message:
Change a log level for overwriting allocation

Change a log level for overwriting allocation
to debug instead of warning
because the log message is output in the normal case
of reverting resize.

Change-Id: I4f2ee3f420b4c78385eeb56c7e8c343af894e75c
Closes-Bug: #1822917

commit_message:
User guide

The review improves User Guide, it adds steps which
describe how to clone and install os_tempest. The
new doc also mentions what has to be set in a playbook
which runs os_tempest.

Change-Id: I7e7f4bf023680904e1c5cdf67dc0113a6f30d779

subject: Write hash after compressing horizon static assets
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-16 06:58:01.000000000', 'files': ['docker/horizon/extend_start.sh'], 'message': 'Write hash after compressing horizon static assets

If you run the horizon container with a restart policy of never, and the
static asset compression fails, the container fails to start, e.g. (seen
in CI)

++ /usr/bin/manage.py collectstatic --noinput --clear
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/bin/manage.py", line 18, in <module>
      from django.core.management import execute_from_command_line
  ImportError: No module named django.core.management

However, with a restart policy of unless-stopped (the default).  the
horizon container will fail the first time but will succeed after a
restart. This is because the settings bundle hash is updated before the
compression is attempted.

To fix this, update the hash after compression completes successfully.

Change-Id: I3f1682ed55e7d45c1e97a1b34c7993aa839f0bb2
Closes-Bug: #1824137
(cherry picked from commit 92c2456851857c45e8de9a3ff8f167579e0588f4)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Write hash after compressing horizon static assets

If you run the horizon container with a restart policy of never, and the
static asset compression fails, the container fails to start, e.g. (seen
in CI)

++ /usr/bin/manage.py collectstatic --noinput --clear
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/bin/manage.py", line 18, in <module>
      from django.core.management import execute_from_command_line
  ImportError: No module named django.core.management

However, with a restart policy of unless-stopped (the default).  the
horizon container will fail the first time but will succeed after a
restart. This is because the settings bundle hash is updated before the
compression is attempted.

To fix this, update the hash after compression completes successfully.

Change-Id: I3f1682ed55e7d45c1e97a1b34c7993aa839f0bb2
Closes-Bug: #1824137
(cherry picked from commit 92c2456851857c45e8de9a3ff8f167579e0588f4)

commit_message:
Fix the bond-with-vlans NIC config DPDK route indentation

This patch fixes an indentation error in the DPDK config for
the network/config/bond-with-vlans/role.role.j2.yaml NIC
config. The DPDK config had the routes at the wrong indentation
level.

Change-Id: Idc1ae952a9f88e10f7dbac11a9f267c159a8ff47

subject: Fix typo in 2-linux-bonds-vlans NIC config templates
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-15 19:13:20.000000000', 'files': ['network/config/2-linux-bonds-vlans/role.role.j2.yaml'], 'message': "Fix typo in 2-linux-bonds-vlans NIC config templates

The network/config/2-linux-bonds-vlans/role.role.j2.yaml contains
a typo in the ControlPlane interface. Instead of
ControlPlaneStaticRoutes, the template contains ControlPlaneRoutes,
which doesn't exist. This patch fixes the get_param.

Change-Id: I331a06339611d423433bea243b10e4c0df8800a3
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix typo in 2-linux-bonds-vlans NIC config templates

The network/config/2-linux-bonds-vlans/role.role.j2.yaml contains
a typo in the ControlPlane interface. Instead of
ControlPlaneStaticRoutes, the template contains ControlPlaneRoutes,
which doesn't exist. This patch fixes the get_param.

Change-Id: I331a06339611d423433bea243b10e4c0df8800a3

commit_message:
Remove usage of oslosphinx

Seems like some recent update of Sphinx broke oslosphinx extension. We
don't really need it now, so this commit removes it by adopting the
"modern" way of building docs (mostly based on how it's done in
openstack/kuryr-kubernetes).

Change-Id: I8a0d5e3923b6497eb7c6944fc6d9adc9007bf5ec
Closes-Bug: 1824958

commit_message:
Fix module imports

The patch fixes module imports in a way they comply with the OpenStack
Coding Guidelines [1], that is:
section 1: standard library modules
section 2: 3rd party modules
section 3: networking_ovn modules

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/hacking/latest/user/hacking.html#imports

Change-Id: Ie48e15c08755619cc278e25cfd211d0d7998138a

* Release note.

subject: Fix conflict exceptions handling in LB creation
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-15 09:18:21.000000000', 'files': ['kuryr_kubernetes/tests/unit/controller/drivers/test_lbaasv2.py', 'kuryr_kubernetes/controller/drivers/lbaasv2.py'], 'message': 'Fix conflict exceptions handling in LB creation

I0a2f89007994fbd7696b0f487affc1b7b643be74 is breaking our workaround for
IP conflict when Kuryr-Controller dies during some LB processing. In
that case, when LB is already created, Kuryr will try to create it again
and fail with either 409 or 500. We should react to those exceptions and
aforementioned patch breaks that by changing the type of exceptions
being raised.

This patch fixes that by adding correct requests.HTTPError exception
type to that try-except clause.

Change-Id: Ic41fe6d5556b2b4721871f9812ddc039a52cf366
Closes-Bug: 1823701
(cherry picked from commit 2a9f5fdcc2f20c1be2b0cfb68c44a3386c407393)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix conflict exceptions handling in LB creation

I0a2f89007994fbd7696b0f487affc1b7b643be74 is breaking our workaround for
IP conflict when Kuryr-Controller dies during some LB processing. In
that case, when LB is already created, Kuryr will try to create it again
and fail with either 409 or 500. We should react to those exceptions and
aforementioned patch breaks that by changing the type of exceptions
being raised.

This patch fixes that by adding correct requests.HTTPError exception
type to that try-except clause.

Change-Id: Ic41fe6d5556b2b4721871f9812ddc039a52cf366
Closes-Bug: 1823701
(cherry picked from commit 2a9f5fdcc2f20c1be2b0cfb68c44a3386c407393)

commit_message:
Pin coredns container image to 1.4.0 tag

coredns 1.5.0 got released recently and removed the proxy plugin which
we use, resulting in coredns being broken. Let's just pin the container
image tag to 1.4.0, as we don't want to fix our config each time coredns
is updated. We can move it forward consciously once there's some feature
we want.

Change-Id: I9099b13b4530049d0218e7165e8e85d14a459f5e
Closes-Bug: 1823855
(cherry picked from commit 559b78532c4ab5f918a4c3632715626251b076be)

subject: eventletutils: Optimise EventletEvent.clear()
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-24 20:44:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "eventletutils: Optimise EventletEvent.clear()

When EventletEvent.clear() is called twice in succession without an
intervening set(), there's no need to replace the underlying
eventlet.event.Event object, since it has never been sent. Doing so
would have woken other greenthreads waiting on the event to no
particular end.

When clear() is called after the event has been set(), we already did
not do anything special with the existing eventlet.event.Event as we
cannot call send() on it twice. We simply replace it with a new one; the
code in wait() will handle the situation correctly, since it will wake
up (due to the initial event having been sent) and begin waiting on the
new eventlet.event.Event instead. This is consistent with the observed
behaviour of threading.Event.

Change-Id: Ibd5324926431fc760c3dd0be064324e3009cc2c2
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2019-01-24 21:02:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "eventletutils: Optimise EventletEvent.clear()

behaviour of threading.Event. A new unit test verifies this.

Change-Id: Ibd5324926431fc760c3dd0be064324e3009cc2c2

When clear() is called after the event has been set(), we already did
not do anything special with the existing eventlet.event.Event as we
cannot call send() on it twice. We simply replace it with a new one; the
code in wait() will handle the situation correctly, since it will wake

Change-Id: Ibd5324926431fc760c3dd0be064324e3009cc2c2
", 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
eventletutils: Optimise EventletEvent.clear()

When EventletEvent.clear() is called twice in succession without an
intervening set(), there's no need to replace the underlying
eventlet.event.Event object, since it has never been sent. Doing so
would have woken other greenthreads waiting on the event to no
particular end.

When clear() is called after the event has been set(), we already did
not do anything special with the existing eventlet.event.Event as we
cannot call send() on it twice. We simply replace it with a new one; the
code in wait() will handle the situation correctly, since it will wake
up (due to the initial event having been sent) and begin waiting on the
new eventlet.event.Event instead. This is consistent with the observed
behaviour of threading.Event. A new unit test verifies this.

Change-Id: Ibd5324926431fc760c3dd0be064324e3009cc2c2

commit_message:
Fix get_base_url

get_base_url method makes assumptions on how the
base URL should look like and trims it up to the
host IP. This change modifies how the base endpoint
is processed so we get the correct values.

Change-Id: Ie01b02f2e731e25fd4032436d3fa106da03af242
Closes-Bug: #1814094
(cherry picked from commit cb1ac1ad910efcd716c2e785699c44179fb1a8cf)

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: I3548290d55fda3a1192fcefb3019c35f60d5b751

commit_message:
Switch python3 versions of test jobs to match Train PTI

In Train, we will use python 3.6 and 3.7 for python3 runtime
in our gate jobs [1]. This commit drops python 3.5 and adds python 3.7.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: I69b11066e334adfddb4ddc8ca2cafc6437d4457d

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1131, 'name': 'Brian Haley', 'email': 'haleyb.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-haley'}, {'_account_id': 7016, 'name': 'Swaminathan Vasudevan', 'email': 'swvasude@cisco.com', 'username': 'souminathan'}, {'_account_id': 17130, 'name': 'melissaml', 'email': 'ma.lei@99cloud.net', 'username': 'malei'}, {'_account_id': 21798, 'name': 'Bernard Cafarelli', 'email': 'bcafarel@redhat.com', 'username': 'bcafarel'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 26622, 'name': 'Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'neutron_hyperv_ci@cloudbasesolutions.com', 'username': 'neutron_hyperv_ci'}, {'_account_id': 28935, 'name': '98k', 'email': '18552437190@163.com', 'username': '98k'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-12 07:01:10.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/l3_hamode_db.py'], 'message': "Choose random value for HA routes' vr_id

HA routers are using keepalived and needs to have virtual_router_id
configured. As routers which belongs to same tenant are using same
ha network, those values have to be different for each router.

Before this patch this value was always taken as first available value
from available_vr_ids range.
In some (rare) cases, when more than one router is created in parallel
for same tenant it may happen that those routers would have same vr_id
choosen so keepalived would treat them as single application and only
one router would be ACTIVE on one of L3 agents.

This patch changes this behaviour that now random value from available
vr_ids will be chosen instead of taking first value always.
That should mittigate this rare race condition that it will be (almost)
not noticable for users.

However, proper fix should be probably done as some additional
constraint in database layer. But such solution wouldn't be possible to
backport to stable branches so I decided to propose this easy patch
first.

Conflicts:
    neutron/db/l3_hamode_db.py

Change-Id: Idb0ed744e54976dca23593fb2d7317bf77442e65
Related-Bug: #1823314
(cherry picked from commit a8d0f557d504957aeb91f451105cca9eee2d6adb)
(cherry picked from commit ee2ed681c495c4fc5086d761853731b7dc2fd34f)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Choose random value for HA routes' vr_id

HA routers are using keepalived and needs to have virtual_router_id
configured. As routers which belongs to same tenant are using same
ha network, those values have to be different for each router.

Before this patch this value was always taken as first available value
from available_vr_ids range.
In some (rare) cases, when more than one router is created in parallel
for same tenant it may happen that those routers would have same vr_id
choosen so keepalived would treat them as single application and only
one router would be ACTIVE on one of L3 agents.

This patch changes this behaviour that now random value from available
vr_ids will be chosen instead of taking first value always.
That should mittigate this rare race condition that it will be (almost)
not noticable for users.

However, proper fix should be probably done as some additional
constraint in database layer. But such solution wouldn't be possible to
backport to stable branches so I decided to propose this easy patch
first.

Conflicts:
    neutron/db/l3_hamode_db.py

Change-Id: Idb0ed744e54976dca23593fb2d7317bf77442e65
Related-Bug: #1823314
(cherry picked from commit a8d0f557d504957aeb91f451105cca9eee2d6adb)
(cherry picked from commit ee2ed681c495c4fc5086d761853731b7dc2fd34f)

commit_message:
Fix the problem of osd initialization failed

When deploying osd, if the user does not use the extra block
partition, the kolla will automatically partition the disk and then
clean up the data on the disk partition. Sometimes the disk partition
will not be updated, there will be an error not finding the partition.

This commit fixes the problem.

Change-Id: I14708f38614dcb75268c2f460ae3d921748c2d10
Closes-bug: #1824787
(cherry picked from commit ddab09fdd8d7c08ce8db70948ea12571bb4267a8)

commit_message:
Fix the problem of osd initialization failed

When deploying osd, if the user does not use the extra block
partition, the kolla will automatically partition the disk and then
clean up the data on the disk partition. Sometimes the disk partition
will not be updated, there will be an error not finding the partition.

This commit fixes the problem.

Change-Id: I14708f38614dcb75268c2f460ae3d921748c2d10
Closes-bug: #1824787
(cherry picked from commit ddab09fdd8d7c08ce8db70948ea12571bb4267a8)

commit_message:
Fix a lifecycle bug with child objects

In some edge cases, when a request comes in to update a child
resource (member, HM, or l7rule), the API would not always make
sure the parent object (pool or l7policy) was in a mutable status.

This patch fixes this by checking the parent provisioning_status
before allowing a muttable change on a child object.

It also resolves two cases where a parent object status was not being
reset on a reverted flow.

Change-Id: I86f76bebce0993215fd34ccd33251ba1e6c325a9
Story: 2005249
Task: 30043

commit_message:
Correct the ovn option name for vhost socket directory

Actual ovn configuration is 'vhost_sock_dir' in networking-ovn
to set the vhostuser socket directory. Change the conf name
from vhostuser_socket_dir to the correct one.

Change-Id: I79130a21a31a589460724a4a68cfadb38ce4d26b

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I0bbb6bea3c1127e473db6c21666b9da1fbe4ab9c

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I7c4132ae25fa8f5c28d2c4373ec9f19c14b76de7

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Idef6539c2662bf57b03f52292ee96ba9c6ada571

This change introduces possibility to use pyroute2 within

routes.

Since the switch to "CacheBackedPluginApi" the ovs-agent didn't try to
rebind ports at startup that were in the "binding_failed" state. This is
because the rebinding was triggered as part of the old implementation of
"get_device_details()" on the server side.

This commit changes the "CacheBackedPluginApi.get_device_details()" call

Closes-bug: #1780453
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix rebinding of "binding_failed" ports on startup

Since the switch to "CacheBackedPluginApi" the ovs-agent didn't try to
rebind ports at startup that were in the "binding_failed" state. This is
because the rebinding was triggered as part of the old implementation of
"get_device_details()" on the server side.

This commit changes the "CacheBackedPluginApi.get_device_details()" call
to fall back to the older implementation when encountering affected Ports.

Change-Id: Id453d85f392320ea852496c4a1c800558aa52dc8
Closes-bug: #1780453

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-12 21:38:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "ovs: survive errors when recovering from ovs restart

If ovs was restarted, and an error happens when resetting bridges /
tunnels / flows, the agent crashes and exits. To avoid that, we
make the agent catch all errors and gracefully ignore them (after
logging details), in hope that the next iteration will be more
successful.

Since we set up canary flows before the rest of _handle_ovs_restart
body, it's possible to receive an error after the flows are set on
bridges. In this case, the next iteration will return OVS_NORMAL from
check_canary_table(). We should handle this situation by forcing full
recovery after OVS restart. This is achieved by introducing the
``recover_needed`` boolean flag that serves as a sticky indication that
an OVS restart happened in the past that we haven't fully recovered
from.

Change-Id: I82597d731bcba38a67f29ba953ee3e14fd532020
Related-Bug: #1731494

commit_message:
ovs: survive errors when recovering from ovs restart

If ovs was restarted, and an error happens when resetting bridges /
tunnels / flows, the agent crashes and exits. To avoid that, we
make the agent catch all errors and gracefully ignore them (after
logging details), in hope that the next iteration will be more
successful.

Since we set up canary flows before the rest of _handle_ovs_restart
body, it's possible to receive an error after the flows are set on
bridges. In this case, the next iteration will return OVS_NORMAL from
check_canary_table(). We should handle this situation by forcing full
recovery after OVS restart. This is achieved by introducing the
``recover_needed`` boolean flag that serves as a sticky indication that
an OVS restart happened in the past that we haven't fully recovered
from.

Change-Id: I82597d731bcba38a67f29ba953ee3e14fd532020
Related-Bug: #1731494

commit_message:
Stop handling 'cell_name' field on Instance.save()

Nothing should be setting these anymore so we can removed it.

Part of blueprint remove-cells-v1

Change-Id: I97d5269b2837c996d294baabb1395e4d90cad070
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-22 10:12:55.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/extradhcpopt_db.py', 'neutron/db/securitygroups_db.py', 'neutron/db/ipam_backend_mixin.py', 'neutron/db/l3_hamode_db.py', 'neutron/db/address_scope_db.py', 'neutron/db/l3_dvr_db.py', 'neutron/db/portsecurity_db_common.py', 'neutron/db/db_base_plugin_v2.py', 'neutron/db/agentschedulers_db.py'], 'message': 'Avoid get_object for small queries

We use neutron objects for
1) RPC between neutron components
2) passing them between functions across modules
3) converting the DB columns to dict and serialize

But for small queries which need only few columns from tables
(without joining other tables), directly querying the databse
will improve the performance.

Co-Authored-By: Joe Talerico <jtaleric@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I7a0316d42b952b9be01c8b7e7db8177d899b8394
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Avoid get_object for small queries

We use neutron objects for
1) RPC between neutron components
2) passing them between functions across modules
3) converting the DB columns to dict and serialize

But for small queries which need only few columns from tables
(without joining other tables), directly querying the databse
will improve the performance.

Co-Authored-By: Joe Talerico <jtaleric@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I7a0316d42b952b9be01c8b7e7db8177d899b8394

[{'created': '2018-09-14 14:43:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'DNM: Test commit to verify fs53 triggers

This is just a test commit to ensure fs53 triggers on
changes made to neutron

commit_message:
Remove the loadbalancer policy rules

These policy rules are used by neutron lbaas which has been
splited out from neutron. In addition, the neutron-lbaas is
deprecated in flavor of octavia, but octavia doesn't use these
rules. This commit removes these rules from sample policy files.

Change-Id: I000e854f8e86a8cccfdc437b8fe0ee689e403229

commit_message:
Remove deprecated option split_branches from migration CLI

The 'split_branches' option in the migration CLI was deprecated in
Newton and scheduled for removal in Ocata.  This finally dispenses with
it.

Change-Id: I2f084a2fa7876bfd298429d9fa0784c269cb7f21

commit_message:
add vmware-nsx non voting py35 job

As per our PTG discussion, networking projects can add non-voting jobs
to neutron check queue as a means to smoke-screen failures introduced by
neutron patches.

This patch adds a non-voting job that runs vmware-nsx UTs with neutron
based on what the requirements repo does [2].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-September/135032.html
[2] https://github.com/openstack/requirements/blob/master/.zuul.d/cross-jobs.yaml

Change-Id: I4641a4e540635590c363a997cf8d20a02b7c24e0

update_tags method to tag OVO delete_objects and create methods.

retry_if_session_inactive decorator looks for context variable

to make it capable of looking for self.context_variable.

commit_message:
Move retry_if_session_inactive to tag OVO

Move db_api.retry_if_session_inactive decorator from tag_plugin
update_tags method to tag OVO delete_objects and create methods as an
effort to move all dependencies to dp_api to OVO, see discussion here:
https://review.openstack.org/565773

commit_message:
Use OVO in neutron/ipam/subnet_alloc.py

Migrate to using Subnet and SubnetPool OVO objects in the IPAM subnet
allocation code.

This removes the test test_subnetpool_concurrent_allocation_exception
from the TestSubnetAllocation tests because that exception is no longer
generated in the objectified code path.

Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db
Change-Id: I0f0a3482a5a91881927cfe39fc40e042d6ac10cd

commit_message:
Floating IPs should not allocate IPv6 addresses

When there are both IPv4 and IPv6 subnets on the public
network, the port that a floating IP allocates there gets
assigned addresses from both subnets.

Allocating an IPv6 address should be avoided for
neutron floating ip if those plugins not support
associating IPv6 floating IPs to IPv4 fixed IPs.

Change-Id: I229ccf1483bf284f6c7f329980c8f391efd4fae9
Closes-Bug: #1752903

commit_message:
Let Neutron enforce rule on create_subnet with segment_id [neutron part]

Neutron ignores rule in policy file [0], that allows non-admin users
to create subnets with segment_id.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/etc/policy.json#L19

Partial-Bug: 1784259
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/598334/
Change-Id: I50bbc1825928090c0ffdea8bafe0378b80b56600

commit_message:
WIP: Give back http403 for get without permission

Operation show (GET /v2.0/resources/uuid) gives back exceptionto the user
if the user has no right (based on policy.json) to fetch the resource.
For list operation (GET v2.0/resources) on the contrary gives back an
empty list, without giving any kind of feedback to the user.
In case the list is empty because there is no resource which can be
visible by the user there should be an error message (http 403 for
example).

TODO:
* Tests (unit, functional?)

Change-Id: Ie4e7d847ca6d404c2b96929b5bab649ab10c3b46
Closes-Bug: #1789499

using rootwrap. This is a way too long, and can be replaced by some calls
to ip using the -batch option.

commit_message:
Speed-up ip neigh replace

With more than 1000 VMs in the same project, and 2 subnet in it (one for
ipv4 and one for ipv6), the l3 agent performs more than 4000 calls to ip
using rootwrap. This is a way too long, and can be replaced by some calls
to ip using the -batch option.

Closes-Bug: #1807396

Change-Id: Ic1c59a67aed6245b070640d7c63a8a96ac234279

commit_message:
Support vlan transparent network for ml2 ovs driver

Now, ovs was supports QinQ, this patch can support vlan
transparent for openvswitch Ml2 driver, when tenant create
network which has 'vlan transprent' property.

This patch uses the already existing property 'vlan_transparent'
of network to indicates that corresponding ovs port needs to be
configure to QinQ mode.

Change-Id: Id1ac60795bbc793ba0777e6a096177d6c1725ad6
Closes-bug: #1604222

commit_message:
Regenerate process config files and parameters

For class ProcessManager, the parameters and config files are generated
by a callback function. This function generates config files and return
the command(with parameters). Sending HUP signal doesn't change
parameters, neither regenerate config files.

This patch is to ensure config files and parameters regenerated in
reload_cfg/restart.

Change-Id: I505676fe822b9cf33903a1de21e386568055478c
Closes-bug: #1809080

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-02-08 14:47:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'DEMO: illustrate how to integrate sqlalchemy "baked" query

The "baked" query system in SQLAlchemy caches the string
SQL statement for a particular Query-construction path.   As
some profiling in Neutron have observed 30-40% time spent in
constructing Query objects due to the many small "fetch-one-object"
style of query, the "baked" system may potentially be able to
greatly reduce this.

In Neutron, most queries come from _model_query(), so in order to
make this possible, all the hooks that feed into _model_query() would
need to provide "baked" versions of their processors.  In order to
allow the "baked" system to integrate gracefully without forcing
those external points to support it, this patch illustrates a system
by which each plugin point is tested for "baked" compatibility
and if not present we fall back to the regular _model_query.

Baked queries: http://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/latest/orm/extensions/baked.html

Change-Id: I695a81b22e7e4006094458d6238b814bd98b6d5d

commit_message:
Use sqlalchemy baked query

The "baked" query system in SQLAlchemy caches the string
SQL statement for a particular Query-construction path.   As
some profiling in Neutron have observed 30-40% time spent in
constructing Query objects due to the many small "fetch-one-object"
style of query, the "baked" system may potentially be able to
greatly reduce this.

In Neutron, most queries come from _model_query(), so in order to
make this possible, all the hooks that feed into _model_query() would
need to provide "baked" versions of their processors.  In order to
allow the "baked" system to integrate gracefully without forcing
those external points to support it, this patch illustrates a system
by which each plugin point is tested for "baked" compatibility
and if not present we fall back to the regular _model_query.

Baked queries: http://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/latest/orm/extensions/baked.html

Change-Id: I695a81b22e7e4006094458d6238b814bd98b6d5d

commit_message:
Fixes metering agent for DVR.

l3 agents on compute nodes get notifications now

iptable rules correctly applied for snat namespaces on controllers

iptables rules correctly applied for qrouter namespaces on computes

Slightly alternative design to
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/621165

Closes-Bug #1807157

Change-Id: Ie5e39d3c92560e7e21d76d00592130ad9ca0ec07

Change-Id: I5e58bb2850bfa8e974e62215af0b4d7bc0592c13
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2018-11-15 18:30:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Enable liberal TCP connection tracking for SNAT namespaces

This can avoid connections randomly hanging due to tcp window
scaling not correctly being tracked.  This prevents packets
which are considered invalid by the connection tracking
from bein thrown out and allows the underlying TCP stack
recovery to function rather than stalling permanently.

Change-Id: I5e58bb2850bfa8e974e62215af0b4d7bc0592c13
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2018-11-20 23:01:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Enable liberal TCP connection tracking for SNAT namespaces

This can avoid connections rarely hanging due to tcp window
scaling not correctly being observed by the TCP connection
tracking. this seems to happen when retransmits are occurring
occassionally.
Setting this parameter turns off validating the window scaling
checks for the purpose of matching whether a packet matches
an existing connection tracked flow, which avoids the SNAT
namespace from interfering and letting the connection peers
recover the connection via retransmits/Selective ACKs instead
of the SNAT terminating one side of the connection and letting
it stall permanently.

Closes-Bug: #1804327

commit_message:
Enable liberal TCP connection tracking for SNAT namespaces

This can avoid connections rarely hanging due to tcp window
scaling not correctly being observed by the TCP connection
tracking. this seems to happen when retransmits are occurring
occassionally.
Setting this parameter turns off validating the window scaling
checks for the purpose of matching whether a packet matches
an existing connection tracked flow, which avoids the SNAT
namespace from interfering and letting the connection peers
recover the connection via retransmits/Selective ACKs instead
of the SNAT terminating one side of the connection and letting
it stall permanently.

Closes-Bug: #1804327
Change-Id: I5e58bb2850bfa8e974e62215af0b4d7bc0592c13

commit_message:
Fix bug when floatingip and router bandwidth speed limit failure

When set mtu value to 64kb， the egress bandwidth limit of the VM
and the routing gateway will be invalid. I have tested it many
times. When set mtu value to 70kb, the bandwidth limit is normal.

For more information, you can read as follow:
[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1785189/comments/5

Change-Id: Id17ad136914dad937c4a8fa5ac0959eb833a26d1
Closes-Bug: #1785189

commit_message:
Remove duplicate  start for AllServicesNeutronWorker

This fixes a random unhealthy state in the neutron_api
as a result of duplicate start for PerodicWorker.

Change-Id: Ic462af66e77892b9ddce3d7828df144b9d9a1376
Close-bug: #1809823

commit_message:
Graceful shutdown for neutron-server api worker

We need wait neutron-server api finish all it's requests
in wait function.

Change-Id: Ief99998513634f0e65ed83962342c739e04e6051
Closes-Bug: #1815871

commit_message:
Increase lease file buffering for dnsmasq lease reads

The default buffer of 4k is too small for larger envs, so
we frequently hit a race. Increase to 64k, which shouldn't
be too much of an overhead and still cover most cases.

Change-Id: I4d88c7e0d378bedb9aac2a42555d35295f447caf
Partial-Bug: #1788556

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-12 16:38:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "WIP Delete floating IPs on network turned internal

A router:external network can have floating IPs while an internal
network cannot. But so far the update of a network's router:external
attribute from True to False was allowed and the floating IPs kept
existing - creating an invalid state of objects.

The original discussion in the bug report suggested prohibiting the
network update in such conditions. But I discovered that a similar
operation (deleting an external net with floating IPs) was allowed
and the invalid state was resolved by automatically deleting the
corresponding floating IPs.

For the sake of consistent API behavior this change does the same for
the network update turning the net to internal.

TODO tests

Change-Id: I2a39752bb4634c841d2d166c2bf03dac73188440
Closes-Bug: #1806032

commit_message:
Delete floating IPs on network turned internal

A router:external network can have floating IPs while an internal
network cannot. But so far the update of a network's router:external
attribute from True to False was allowed and the floating IPs kept
existing - creating an invalid state of objects.

The original discussion in the bug report suggested prohibiting the
network update in such conditions. But I discovered that a similar
operation (deleting an external net with floating IPs) was allowed
and the invalid state was resolved by automatically deleting the
corresponding floating IPs.

For the sake of consistent API behavior this change does the same for
the network update turning the net to internal.

As discussed in review a change like this in API behavior needs to be
discoverable by an API extension. Therefore this change also introduces
a shim extension: floatingip-autodelete-internal.

APIImpact: New extension: floatingip-autodelete-internal.

Change-Id: I2a39752bb4634c841d2d166c2bf03dac73188440
Closes-Bug: #1806032
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/637935

commit_message:
[WIP] Add native OVSDB implementation for polling monitor

TODO: remove prints and extra logs for debugging

This patch implements an OVS interface monitor based in the OVSDB
native implementation (OVSDB IDL, Open vSwitch Database Interface
Definition Language).

Closes-Bug: #1789592

Change-Id: I41651cafa21b90d3d07a2da882d35a762f29a727

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: I160c141169d68fd9403604c68cecde0c70c463c3

commit_message:
the PeriodicWorker class init misssing desc argument

After this pr merged,https://review.openstack.org/#/c/637019/
we should add the default desc in PeriodicWorker class. Otherwise
some class based on the PeriodicWorker which does not set the
setproctitle =off in neutorn.conf will get an exception.
like below, where set_proctitle is None and there is no
setproctitle config

Closes-Bug:#1818765

Change-Id: Ib3e0273308b1c7824a1bd78a51b826e429d38fa4

commit_message:
Set keepalived command name

In order to be able to kill the keepalived state change monitor, we set
its command name to a known constant.

Change-Id: I4e99bfd095bdb1f7959478aa76751c1c24c3c4e2
Partial-Bug: #1795870

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-15 12:39:10.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/conf/agent/l3/config.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/namespaces.py'], 'message': 'WiP/PoC - Router Namespace - Connection Tracker helper

!! This is a PoC only.

In Bionic the nf_conntrack_helper is disabled by default.
This is good security practice, but causes issues for
Ironic CI which need conntrack for TFTP traffic.

The solution seem to be to add firewall rules to the
router namespace to explicitly enable the tftp helper
for the specific port. Example:

 -A PREROUTING -p udp -m udp --dport 69 -j CT --helper tftp

This change adds a config option in l3_agent which allow
specifying a list of dics such as:
  {helper: tftp, proto: udp, port: 69}

The data is then used to apply the firewall rules in the
namespace when it is created.

Change-Id: I88b45799265b8fafcae37f0f0fb0f1106efb1a06
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
WiP/PoC - Router Namespace - Connection Tracker helper

!! This is a PoC only.

In Bionic the nf_conntrack_helper is disabled by default.
This is good security practice, but causes issues for
Ironic CI which need conntrack for TFTP traffic.

The solution seem to be to add firewall rules to the
router namespace to explicitly enable the tftp helper
for the specific port. Example:

 -A PREROUTING -p udp -m udp --dport 69 -j CT --helper tftp

This change adds a config option in l3_agent which allow
specifying a list of dics such as:
  {helper: tftp, proto: udp, port: 69}

The data is then used to apply the firewall rules in the
namespace when it is created.

Change-Id: I88b45799265b8fafcae37f0f0fb0f1106efb1a06

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ib04cb5c282eb8e07210ef83676213e41b629f889

commit_message:
rehome policy and cache_utils

Today we have neutron_lib._policy that is 1/2 baked, out of sync and was
never consumed.

This patch updates neutron_lib's policy with the latest from neutron
with the following changes:
- Removed TODO about API attribute typing; we have that IIUC.
- Removed NOTE about _extract() relying on core plugin; we now have the
plugin directory in neutron-lib which IIUC solves this NOTE.
- Removed the 'plugin' kwarg from enforce() and check(). This kwarg is
deprecated and not used by the functions. Now is the time to clean it
up.

In addition neutron.common.cache_utils is rehomed as
neutron_lib.utils.cache. While not used outside neutron today [1], it's
needed by policy and generic in nature.

TEMP TESTING PATCH for neutron consumption:
Depends-On: I300323961a35385e597d803348ca2f877ee55fdd

[1] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=from%20neutron.common%20import%20cache_utils

Change-Id: I788d3c4080fb7ef3f2c1edf1ea3d955f81634732

commit_message:
rehome securitygroup api def

This patch rehomes the security group API definition. Note that as part
of the rehome a handful of the error messages used on its API validation
and conversion have changed (not the response codes) as a result of
using generic validators/converters rather than 1-off API specific
functions.

A unit test and release note area also included.

Depends-On: I13f24ae7d987b092bb60554ef46e89d882e6782e
Change-Id: I9466274a5236645471c1d0aab5c692b4728b8c6c

subject: support custom exceptions for api validation
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-04 22:50:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "support custom exceptions for api validation

Today the exception class used when attribute validation fails is
defined by the API itself when calling neutron_lib to validate data
in neutron_lib.api.attributes.AttributeInfo.convert_values. While
this makes sense most of time, there are cases when api definitions
want to override this default exception.

A classic example is an API extension pre-creates a resource upon
start-up; and this resource name is off-limits to API users. In such
a case the extension may want raise an InUse exception, rather than
a InvalidInput exception to signify the behavior.

This is done today, for example, in neutron's security group extension's
name_not_default validator [1]. Here users cannot create security groups
with any form of the name 'default' and it's enforced at the API
validation level. To signify a custom exception is used which translates
into a 409 HTTP response code rather than the default 400 otherwise.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/extensions/securitygroup.py#L197

Change-Id: I13f24ae7d987b092bb60554ef46e89d882e6782e
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2017-12-04 22:54:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "support custom exceptions for api validation

Today the exception class used when attribute validation fails is
defined by the API itself when calling neutron_lib to validate data
in neutron_lib.api.attributes.AttributeInfo.convert_values. While
this makes sense most of time, there are cases when api definitions
want to override this default exception.

A classic example is an API extension pre-creates a resource upon
start-up; and this resource name is off-limits to API users. In such
a case the extension may want raise an InUse exception, rather than
a InvalidInput exception to signify the behavior.

This is done today, for example, in neutron's security group extension's
name_not_default validator [1]. Here users cannot create security groups
with any form of the name 'default' and it's enforced at the API
validation level. To signify a custom exception is used which translates
into a 409 HTTP response code rather than the default 400 otherwise.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/extensions/securitygroup.py#L197

Change-Id: I13f24ae7d987b092bb60554ef46e89d882e6782e
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2017-12-08 20:52:47.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lib/api/attributes.py', 'doc/source/contributor/api_validators.rst', 'neutron_lib/api/validators/__init__.py', 'releasenotes/notes/custom-api-validator-exceptions-2a000c6a89efc5cf.yaml'], 'message': "support custom exceptions for api validation

As part of adding API definitions to neutron-lib, we want to reuse the
generic validators as much as possible. However as part of this reuse
we shouldn't impact the ability of an API to provide more meaningful
validation error messages that ultimately may ease the API user
experience. Moreover some API's need to customize the HTTP code returned
on validation failure [1].

Today we don't provide a way to customize the generic validator
exceptions/messages, so API's who need more specific error messages
(ex: [1][2]) only have the option to create 1-off validators for
their specific exceptions/messages.

This patch proposes that we allow APIs to customize this exception
class/message by having validators encapsulate their validation
failure data into an object that can then be used by a custom
exception. In addition a basic set of objects are provided to
implement the notion of validation results, options, etc.

Existing style validators that just return a string will still work,
but will be limited in terms of how useful they are for customized
exceptions. To that end this patch updates all lib's validators to use
the new style objects and clarifies that validators should not raise
exceptions unless they are programmatic in nature.

NeutronCoreInputNeeded

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/extensions/securitygroup.py
[2] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/extensions/subnet_service_types.py

Change-Id: I13f24ae7d987b092bb60554ef46e89d882e6782e
", 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
support custom exceptions for api validation

As part of adding API definitions to neutron-lib, we want to reuse the
generic validators as much as possible. However as part of this reuse
we shouldn't impact the ability of an API to provide more meaningful
validation error messages that ultimately may ease the API user
experience. Moreover some API's need to customize the HTTP code returned
on validation failure [1].

Today we don't provide a way to customize the generic validator
exceptions/messages, so API's who need more specific error messages
(ex: [1][2]) only have the option to create 1-off validators for
their specific exceptions/messages.

This patch proposes that we allow APIs to customize this exception
class/message by having validators encapsulate their validation
failure data into an object that can then be used by a custom
exception. In addition a basic set of objects are provided to
implement the notion of validation results, options, etc.

Existing style validators that just return a string will still work,
but will be limited in terms of how useful they are for customized
exceptions. To that end this patch updates all lib's validators to use
the new style objects and clarifies that validators should not raise
exceptions unless they are programmatic in nature.

NeutronCoreInputNeeded

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/extensions/securitygroup.py
[2] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/extensions/subnet_service_types.py

Change-Id: I13f24ae7d987b092bb60554ef46e89d882e6782e

commit_message:
WIP: Rehome libnetfilter_log to neutron-lib

libnetfilter_log is a python binding for netfilter_log API. This library
will be used for firewall group, security group (firewall driver based
iptables) and snat logging to capture packets.

Change-Id: I681f42fb730ad137d47160fc397e03edc1631dfa

commit_message:
WIP: rehome neutron.objects.base and deps

There are a number of consumers today who use neutron.objects.base
[1] and it's conceivable others may need it as OVO is adopted. This
patch rehomes neutron.objects.base and its dependencies and also
includes a test fixture for mocking out the neutron.objects.db.api CRUD
functions.

For a sample consumption patch see:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/620999

[1] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=from%20neutron.objects%20import%20base

Change-Id: I8173c59f26c3a52ea9abf52a58b64a82e1599466

commit_message:
Use unstable_test decorator from neutron-lib

As unstable_test is available in neutron-lib/utils/test.py.
This patch updates the plugin to consume unstable_test from
neutron-lib.

Change-Id: I3aaefa5dc38b5079cdbd98d4ac89df0d03f99eae

commit_message:
Refactor QoS test to make it more reliable

Try to fix some problems and code quality of QoS related tests:
- implement delete_qos_policy method in API base test class and make
  sure it is called to delete QoS policies using the same client used
  to create them (as for other resource type)
- Move QoS floating IP scenario test to QoS test_qos.py test as it uses
  the same base code as the test there (this semplifies and reduces the
  code)
- Fix QoS policies leaks in scenario tests using API base test methdos.
- Implement standalone bash script to test download bandwith with a
  remote server using ncat tool from nmap project (only available on
  advanced images)
- Patch network client to allow creating policies without the optional
  parameter is_default (because it requires qos-default extension)
- Install nmap packace inside Ubuntu guest images

Change-Id: I6eb5e451da2ffb1915c44dcc2354978e56321e4e

commit_message:
debian: add support

This patch adds support for this role to be able to deploy on
Debian Stretch.

Change-Id: Ib5e04011519c67e72a0e64f511bc673527eb4db9
Needed-By: I9a92b73c419a0dc1cca40dacfef75de61a61db94
(cherry picked from commit 0ea86c6967061043b0b39ffcf75a13085d871802)

default parameters passed to ping command.

ping command wrapper.

Write a new function called ping.get_statistics able of executing
ping command in either a remote host or on local host
and parsing actual ping command output to report ping statistis.

Additional mixin test case mixin class is provided to allow sending
ping message until some specific condition are met:
 - a 'count' of messages is transmitted
 - a 'count' of messages is delivered (transmitted without errors)
 - a 'count' of messages is not delivered (transmitted with errors)
 - a 'count' of messages is received
 - a 'count' of messages is not received (transmitted but not received)

Some new configuration options has been added to tune default
parameters passed to ping command.

Some logic has been added to support CirrOS CLI differences from
regular Unix shells.

This tool allows to make far more precise verifications regarding
ICMP connectivity by reporting more result details than just reporting
success or failure.

commit_message:
Add reusable ping command wrapper.

Refactor ping connectivity verification on top of a reusable
ping command wrapper.

Write a new function called ping.get_statistics able of executing
ping command in either a remote host or on local host
and parsing actual ping command output to report ping statistis.

Additional mixin test case mixin class is provided to allow sending
ping message until some specific condition are met:
 - a 'count' of messages is transmitted
 - a 'count' of messages is delivered (transmitted without errors)
 - a 'count' of messages is not delivered (transmitted with errors)
 - a 'count' of messages is received
 - a 'count' of messages is not received (transmitted but not received)

Some new configuration options has been added to tune default
parameters passed to ping command.

Some logic has been added to support CirrOS CLI differences from
regular Unix shells.

This tool allows to make far more precise verifications regarding
ICMP connectivity by reporting more result details than just reporting
success or failure.

Change-Id: I196f3e29eb117dd81ee5721a57ef0b50eef4eca2

commit_message:
Fix support for v1 manifests

v1 manifests store the layer digests in a different way, which the
prepare code has conditional logic to handle, however this is missing
from image copy when discovering source layer digests.

There is also a v1 manifest format error in the image export delete code.

This change fixes both of these issues, which should make it possible
to copy images from quay.io.

Change-Id: I3e6c95beb387dc4b462eb037eeb8cb628016b7e4
Closes-Bug: #1823821

subject: Remove message about circular role inferences
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-27 08:26:28.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/assignment/core.py'], 'message': 'Remove message about circular role inferences

While Cycles could be a problem, this code was detercting them even
when there were none.  If a role gets added twice, it was reporting
an error, but that is possible from the case where two distinct prior
add the same implied role.  Just move on quietly.

closes-bug 1803780

Change-Id: I804e5084f74ff4afdd582ece02ff2c833c5f6eb1
(cherry picked from commit 78566e828659b201563e7d07823df30f7b00b0d4)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove message about circular role inferences

While Cycles could be a problem, this code was detercting them even
when there were none.  If a role gets added twice, it was reporting
an error, but that is possible from the case where two distinct prior
add the same implied role.  Just move on quietly.

closes-bug 1803780

Change-Id: I804e5084f74ff4afdd582ece02ff2c833c5f6eb1
(cherry picked from commit 78566e828659b201563e7d07823df30f7b00b0d4)

subject: Make cloudkitty-processor run several workers
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-12 08:51:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Make cloudkitty-processor run several workers

This makes the processor run several workers in separate processes by
default, leading to a big performance increase. The maximal number of workers
can be configured. Work items:

* Use cotyledon to spawn several workers.

* Remove eventlet monkey patching and use the "threading" executor for
  messaging in order to avoid conflict with cotyledon internal threads.

Change-Id: I7e2a77cb7d68afb87274fb44fb208306c3b32473
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2019-04-12 08:53:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Make cloudkitty-processor run several workers

This makes the processor run several workers in separate processes by

commit_message:
Make cloudkitty-processor run several workers

This makes the processor run several workers in separate processes by
default, leading to a big performance increase. The maximal number of workers
can be configured. Work items:

* Use cotyledon to spawn several workers.

* Remove eventlet monkey patching and use the "threading" executor for
  messaging in order to avoid conflict with cotyledon internal threads.

Story: 2005423
Task: 30447
Change-Id: I7e2a77cb7d68afb87274fb44fb208306c3b32473

commit_message:
Allow 'container image prepare' to support drivers

This updates the 'overcloud container image prepare' command
so that it sets the neutron_driver variable correctly. This
allows tripleo-common to detect if OVN or ODL drivers are in
used and prepares the resulting output files for container
images and parameters accordingly.

Previously you could only access this functionality if you
used the new ContainerImagePrepare workflow (requires Mistral).

Change-Id: Icb5b20bfd98a704f3f33f739bc92f77550b52c26
Closes-bug: #1816663

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I4aaba31efbabd05f95721021a60c8b8049448e77

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: I3302ddc87ca65500263614925a003fa7de8d1391

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-10 11:47:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Write hash after compressing horizon static assets

If you run the horizon container with a restart policy of never, and the
static asset compression fails, the container fails to start, e.g. (seen
in CI)

++ /usr/bin/manage.py collectstatic --noinput --clear
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/bin/manage.py", line 18, in <module>
      from django.core.management import execute_from_command_line
  ImportError: No module named django.core.management

However, with a restart policy of unless-stopped (the default).  the
horizon container will fail the first time but will succeed after a
restart. This is because the settings bundle hash is updated before the
compression is attempted.

To fix this, update the hash after compression completes successfully.

Change-Id: I3f1682ed55e7d45c1e97a1b34c7993aa839f0bb2
Closes-Bug: #1824137
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2019-04-10 14:10:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Write hash after compressing horizon static assets

commit_message:
Write hash after compressing horizon static assets

If you run the horizon container with a restart policy of never, and the
static asset compression fails, the container fails to start, e.g. (seen
in CI)

++ /usr/bin/manage.py collectstatic --noinput --clear
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/bin/manage.py", line 18, in <module>
      from django.core.management import execute_from_command_line
  ImportError: No module named django.core.management

However, with a restart policy of unless-stopped (the default).  the
horizon container will fail the first time but will succeed after a
restart. This is because the settings bundle hash is updated before the
compression is attempted.

To fix this, update the hash after compression completes successfully.

Change-Id: I3f1682ed55e7d45c1e97a1b34c7993aa839f0bb2
Closes-Bug: #1824137

commit_message:
Constraint networkx to <2.3 for Python 2

networkx >=2.3 supports Python 3 only [1]. This patch constraints
networkx to <2.3 for Python 2.

[1] https://networkx.github.io/documentation/stable/news.html#networkx-2-3

Change-Id: Icfc804f40130a613ac78165e487853c47c87e49c

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: I5661e9cdf3644d785e004b7bd99989d514676757

commit_message:
Add Python 3.6 and Python 3.7 jobs

According to 'Tested Runtimes for Train' [1] we need to support
Python 2.7, Python 3.7 and Python 3.6 runtimes.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: I449cb6dbad63cca99fbd8a193a59aee326d289f0

subject: Fix the problem of osd initialization failed
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-15 10:14:40.000000000', 'files': ['docker/ceph/ceph-osd/extend_start.sh'], 'message': 'Fix the problem of osd initialization failed

When deploying osd, if the user does not use the extra block
partition, the kolla will automatically partition the disk and then
clean up the data on the disk partition. Sometimes the disk partition
will not be updated, there will be an error not finding the partition.

This commit fixes the problem.

Change-Id: I14708f38614dcb75268c2f460ae3d921748c2d10
Closes-bug: #1824787
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix the problem of osd initialization failed

When deploying osd, if the user does not use the extra block
partition, the kolla will automatically partition the disk and then
clean up the data on the disk partition. Sometimes the disk partition
will not be updated, there will be an error not finding the partition.

This commit fixes the problem.

Change-Id: I14708f38614dcb75268c2f460ae3d921748c2d10
Closes-bug: #1824787

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I28edbeb718f162fbee01b9fbd30b214bc9aab3f8

commit_message:
Trim whitespace in multi-line env descriptions

Indenting blank description lines just creates unnecessary trailing
whitespace in the output file.  Skip the indentation in this case.

Change-Id: Ib0fbd26b489f6d9cf262c1186d3b3e604d4c0c67

subject: Correct error catching while in "--check" mode
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 17823, 'name': 'Michele Baldessari', 'email': 'michele@redhat.com', 'username': 'mbaldessari'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 29315, 'name': 'Victor Voronkov', 'email': 'vvoronko@redhat.com'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-15 11:42:33.000000000', 'files': ['docker/services/haproxy.yaml'], 'message': 'Correct error catching while in "--check" mode

When we're in "--check" mode with Ansible, the variable is defined,
but its content doesn't match the one we might get when actually applying
the run.
The right way to detect that is to check if the variable is changed.

In "--check", it is not changed, meaning we can't get the "rc" attribute.

I5851dc7820fdcc4f5790980d94b81622ce3b0c8d didn't do the right check, and
does not improve the situation.

Change-Id: I77c655addd0fe01948584fb43ba24d5b24ff330e
Closes-Bug: #1823841
(cherry picked from commit cb9497d76b22aaa8ad38c07183fbc551dbda3acf)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Correct error catching while in "--check" mode

When we're in "--check" mode with Ansible, the variable is defined,
but its content doesn't match the one we might get when actually applying
the run.
The right way to detect that is to check if the variable is changed.

In "--check", it is not changed, meaning we can't get the "rc" attribute.

I5851dc7820fdcc4f5790980d94b81622ce3b0c8d didn't do the right check, and
does not improve the situation.

Change-Id: I77c655addd0fe01948584fb43ba24d5b24ff330e
Closes-Bug: #1823841
(cherry picked from commit cb9497d76b22aaa8ad38c07183fbc551dbda3acf)

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: I7d3fab02f1ae89aa6c675ce19a9858a1729323c1

subject: Revert "readOnlyRootFilesystem: true for openvswitch chart"
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-15 22:45:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Revert "readOnlyRootFilesystem: true for openvswitch chart"

I believe when we have set the readOnly flag at pod without HTK functionality the changes were not reflected. That is why it passed the gate.

Later with HTK functionality the gates never passed and I have tested that in various ways and finally I had to unset the readOnly flag

This reverts commit 598040bea05737ea1ee2460ba8675ed7c061e63a.

Change-Id: Icf8d3cc60045926ab60b9735ee1e8202c15df9d5
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2019-04-16 02:28:32.000000000', 'files': ['openvswitch/templates/daemonset-ovs-db.yaml', 'openvswitch/templates/daemonset-ovs-vswitchd.yaml'], 'message': 'Revert "readOnlyRootFilesystem: true for openvswitch chart"

I believe when we have set the readOnly flag at pod without HTK functionality the changes were not reflected. That is why it passed the gate.

Later with HTK functionality the gates never passed and I have tested that in various ways and finally I had to unset the readOnly flag

This reverts commit 598040bea05737ea1ee2460ba8675ed7c061e63a.

Change-Id: Icf8d3cc60045926ab60b9735ee1e8202c15df9d5
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Revert "readOnlyRootFilesystem: true for openvswitch chart"

I believe when we have set the readOnly flag at pod without HTK functionality the changes were not reflected. That is why it passed the gate.

Later with HTK functionality the gates never passed and I have tested that in various ways and finally I had to unset the readOnly flag

This reverts commit 598040bea05737ea1ee2460ba8675ed7c061e63a.

Change-Id: Icf8d3cc60045926ab60b9735ee1e8202c15df9d5

commit_message:
Use ISO8601 format for timestamp fields

Most OpenStack services use format ISO8601 for timestamp fields
like 'created_at' or 'updated_at'. This commit makes Zun adopt
this convention.

Change-Id: I900b2f106d2ea0c044140077dfda39e1402a09ac

commit_message:
Refactor the code of API controller/view

Extract view out of controllers: ContainerAction, ContainerActionEvent,
and Service. This makes improve the modularity and consistency of
the code.

commit_message:
Set Standalone's br-ctlplane MTU

Set the br-ctlplane MTU to the InterfaceLocalMtu value. This is
required when multiple Standalone nodes are used in a split-stack
deployment.

Closes-Bug: #1823993

commit_message:
Skip populating container's state on tasks

If there is a task acting on this container, skip syncing its
state on _populate_container_state to avoid conflicts.

commit_message:
Release cinderlib 0.9.0

This commit releases cinderlib 0.9.0 as agreed in the Cinder team
meeting to reflect it is a Tech Preview release, but almost ready for
production.

We release cinderlib as an independent project in this cycle, but it
will be moved to the cycle-trailing release cycle on Train, which fits
nicely with its dependency on the Cinder project.  After all cinderlib
treats Cinder as a mere driver package.

Change-Id: Idc37f4c66f9eb38126bafc49326427db67713503

subject: Change sample id from int to BigInt
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-28 23:21:54.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/storage/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/046_sample_id_to_bigint.py', 'ceilometer/storage/sqlalchemy/models.py'], 'message': 'Change sample id from int to BigInt

For long running users of Ceilometer with heavy sample loads,
the index for samples can run out of numbers.  The int type only
allows over 2 billion samples to be loaded.  To allow a user
with database backed sample storage (postgres or mysql) to continue
to operate, we need to up the data type to BigInteger.

Change-Id: I9ed1d69a05efd47368497674ffe68b43c8dc1074
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Change sample id from int to BigInt

For long running users of Ceilometer with heavy sample loads,
the index for samples can run out of numbers.  The int type only
allows over 2 billion samples to be loaded.  To allow a user
with database backed sample storage (postgres or mysql) to continue
to operate, we need to up the data type to BigInteger.

Change-Id: I9ed1d69a05efd47368497674ffe68b43c8dc1074

commit_message:
Refactoring of Enforcer class

Now that policy rules can be registered in code there is a desire to run
projects without a policy file. However oslo.policy assumed a policy
file would exist and would raise an error if it could not be found. This
was fixed by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/341732/

After this fix it became noticible that Enforcer class
not only enforces but also stores rules. And this should be changed.
Enforcing and storing shoud be separated.

These changes make Enforcer logic more simple.
And Enforcer can be extendend or improved without adding
more flags.
Everything related to file was moved to FileRulesCache class.
It is easy to read code or debug.
This refactoring shouldn't break anything in projects
because Enforcer API was not changed.

Change-Id: Iaddb1f096a4a085f08b83e3c86c3910b7e26f40a
Closes-Bug: #1603329
